subject: Re: [junit] @Test annotation for JUnit 3.8.1
msgSnippet: Hello, you cannot use the @Test annotation for JUnit 3.8.1. It is a new annotation introduced in JUnit 4.0 (org.junit.Test). JUnit 3.8.1 does not define any
messageBody:
Hello,

you cannot use the @Test annotation for JUnit 3.8.1. It is a new
annotation introduced in JUnit 4.0 (org.junit.Test). JUnit 3.8.1 does
not define any annotation classes.

The annotation probably complaints that the @Test annotation (annotation
class) is unknown.

Marian Petras


Kamal Ahmed wrote:
> Hi,
>
> Can I use the @Test notation for JUnit 3.8.1 ? e.g. in :
>
> @Test(expected=IndexOutOfBoundsException.class)
> public void testIndexOutOfBoundsException() {
> ArrayList emptyList = new ArrayList();
> Object o = emptyList.get(0);
> }
>
> If I use it in my test, I get a pop-up asking me to add the annotation @Test
>
> Thanks,
> -Kamal.
